column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=What are your views on the mixed member proportional representation ( MMP ) referendum ?
#Text=My view is that the MMP system is better for everyone .
#Text=In the short term it is obviously better for smaller parties such as the Greens .
#Text=In the 2006 federal election the Green Party of Canada won 4.5 % of the vote .
#Text=Fairness would seem to dictate that out of the 308 seats in the House of Commons , around 14 should be Green MPs .
#Text=Yet there is not one Green MP in the House .
#Text=Nearly 700,000 Canadians voted Green .
#Text=Not one of them is represented by their party in the House of Commons .
#Text=In the 2003 Ontario election the Green Party only won 2.8 % of the vote .
#Text=Under the proposed MMP system we would not have been able to appoint an MPP .
#Text=Yet we would only need an additional 0.2 % to be eligible for , presumably , three to four MPPs .
#Text=Clearly , this would be good for the Green Party of Ontario .
#Text=In the longer term it would also be good for the larger parties , and for those who vote for them .
#Text=It ’s true that their power stands to be diluted somewhat by parties that have broad support across the province , which will impair their ability to pass the laws they want today .
#Text=But we all have to live under those laws , and in a democracy that means we should be represented in their creation .
#Text=When we ’re not , those laws begin to lack legitimacy .
#Text=In 2003 , 43.2 % of eligible voters in Ontario did not show up at the polls .
#Text=There is something wrong when almost half of the people in our province who can have a say in the rules we live under choose not to .
#Text=There are likely many reasons why people do n’t show up , but one is certainly that many people feel their vote does not really count .
#Text=It has no influence .

#Text=This will be a problem for all of us in the long run because , the fewer people who participate in the creation of our laws , the less legitimate those laws will appear to be to an increasing number of people .
#Text=When we have an opportunity to strengthen the foundations on which our society rests , we should take it .
#Text=A concern I ’ve heard about MMP is that it could result in a large number of unelected MPPs .
#Text=To understand this concern , consider this example .
#Text=You have a legislature with 100 seats .
#Text=Party X wins 20 % of the provincial vote , but only 15 seats .
#Text=Under MMP
#Text=Party X will be allowed to appoint five MPPs from their list to bring them up to 20 seats .
#Text=The concern is that those five MPPs are not elected , but appointed from a list , and that they will not be responsible for any particular riding .
